name: A C
text: They are wonderful!!

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Heather Milton
text: Very nice, fast and professional!

resp.text: We’re thrilled that you’re happy with our services

name: Missy Powell
text: Nice place with very fast, professional services. Hope they get enough referrals to stay in business in Prattville. Recommend you getting your Imaging services, including same day MRI, at this facility as you can usually choose where you want to go yourself! Utilize this place as we want to keep a place this nice in our "Preferred Community"!

name: Jonathan Eric Headley
text: Very nice facility. Easy to get to very nice and professional staff. Always easy to talk to and help in anyway possible. They try everyway to make you comfortable. I went in January 2018 for an MRI and I am about to have another one. I am requesting Sonos Imaging. They even have snacks and drinks for their patients. If I could give more stars I would.

name: Leslie Pettway
text: Really nice staff and the office and customer changing room was beautiful.

name: Joel Banyai
text: In the past few months I've had work done and sent multiple friends to this shop. They've fixed cars other shops won't touch (or messed up), and saved my friends and I a ton of money. We all know warranty work doesn't pay the bills, but when an alternator they had rebuilt and installed failed, they had a new alternator swapped in the next morning. On another repair they offered a good used part they had on hand for much cheaper instead of charging for a brand new part. Another car had a strange symptom; they correctly diagnosed two cascading failures up the line and fixed everything. If a repair isn't going to be cost effective, they'll tell you that too.  I'm extremely pleased. You won't go wrong going here.

name: Lisa P
text: Quick service. Great price.

name: Jane Knauss
text: Very nice and knowledgeable. Quick turnaround and reasonable prices. Highly recommend!

name: Alexandria Haley
text: This man does an amazing job with rewiring...

name: Ikram Singh
text:
I think they did a pretty decent/good job on my windshield wipers and front window rotor. Had the car ready the very next day. The guy is a PROFESSIONAL but I think I was OVERLY CHARGED !!
If it was not for the HIGH CHARGE I would definitely visit this place again.

resp.text: We appreciate your business and we believe our prices are very competitive.

name: Josh Knowling
text: I recently took my truck to Russell Brothers with a tricky electrical issue that had persisted despite previous mechanic's best efforts.  I was skeptical at first that a solution would be reached.  Initially, Russell Brothers did fail in their first attempt at correcting it, despite having replaced expensive components.  However, after a couple of return trips, their persistence paid off and they expertly diagnosed and ultimately corrected the issue for good.  I would like to thank technician 'Jim' in particular in showing great integrity, reaching out to me when he knew the issue was not correctly repaired.  Will used their service again in the future, as well as recommend it to others. Thanks fellas!

resp.text: Thank you Josh! We truly appreciate you taking the time for the awesome review!

name: jdblackbelt
text: I have been bringing my vehicles here for service and maintenance for 10 years now. They regularly charge me half what the dealership has quoted me for the same job. They're always busy (as people have caught on they do phenomenal work for fair prices), so sometimes you'll have to wait an extra day for your vehicle, but you'll always save money. Jim and Robbie have always taken care of me, know me by name, and only recommend repairs and maintenance on what's necessary. There's a reason they've been in business since the 70's. Can't recommend them highly enough.

resp.text: That is so very special that you that the time to write such a wonderful review. We appreciate you taking your time to give us such a kind and thoughtful review. Sincerely, thanks so very much!

text: Best place to get my truck fixed. I took my truck in at approximately 12:30 and they were done by 3:00. Excellent prices, friendly guys, really smart. They know what they are doing and are honest to their prices. They are awesome all around. We will continue to keep taking our vehicles there.

resp.text: Thanks so much!!!

name: Jake Self
text: Had to return a few times but they was kinda working me in I still recommend them. Let me clarify this statement instead of changing it. When I say return a few times I mean too fix several problems. Only once was something unfinished properly on my alternator/battery, and had to have it towed back. No extra charge but I did feel that they should've covered the TOW TAG.😂😂😭👌🤘👍✌️

name: Robert Robb
text: Charged me $400 to fix a bad wire going to the AC clutch (no parts).  At $85/hour that means it took them almost 5 hrs to fix.  I had looked at the problem before I brought the car in and had narrowed it down to the AC clutch so I asked when i pick it up if it was on the ground or power side.  He wouldn't tell me .  When I looked under the car I could see where they used a wire jumper like whats used for connecting trailer lights to connect to another ground wire that must have been good.  I had expected 2 to 3 hundred but with the mechanic refusing to answer a simple question left me questioning.

name: Jovan Coates
text: Russell Brothers Auto is the best repair shop in this city hands down.  I have been having my vehicles serviced there for over ten years.  They have kept things running that others have said could not be fixed, or a dealership suggests that it's time to purchase another vehicle.   They work on any make and model of vehicle and can perform any type of maintenance from fluid changes, up to engine replacement.  The staff is friendly and the service top notch.  They have always had my vehicles ready the same day I drop them off.  The value cannot be beat.  They do not suggest needless services just to pad an invoice, if your car is not running or something electrical doesn't work, they will immediately get to the heart of the problem and take care of it.  They stand by their work and I will wholeheartedly recommend to anyone if you need your car repaired take it to Russell Brothers, you won't be disappointed.

resp.text: Thanks so kindly!!!

text: So far so good. Very understanding. They helped budget my repairs into 3 visit depending on severity of problems. As long as people remember most problems can't be solved same day. Good mechanics, not miracle workers!

resp.text: Appreciate you very much. Thank you for being our customer!

name: Briana Wright
text:
If I could rate it at half a star I would. Avoid this place like the Ebola.
Though Ebola Might be easier to deal with than these clowns.
* NO Communication.
* NO Realistic estimate.
* NO Time frame for repairs to be completed.
* NO Call to authorize ordering of expensive parts.
* NO Friendly service, in fact, acted as if simple questions were a bother to answer, and indeed were NOT answered.

In the End I had my Car towed away to take to elsewhere.. where the car was fixed, and on the road the next day, for the same price as I was charged by these yahoos for ripping apart my dashboard.

name: Thomas Taylor
text:
These guys will fix those cars that no one else will even touch. They repair a Porsche Cayenne (a real PIB to fix) to a 20 year old beater that most would charge more than the car is worth.

The guy that was crabbing about his experience...., If you say "Fix it!" they will fix it. If you say tell me what is wrong and how much, then they will do that as well. BTW, it cost $$ to diagnose and this is sometimes the most expensive part of a repair. Communication is key and it goes both ways.

These guys are about the only honest ones left. They are so good that many dealers around town bring their used cars to them because their own mechanics can neither fix nor diagnose what is wrong with them. Or maybe they just don't want to get their hands dirty!
Jim and his guys will get greasy and keep you on the road!

resp.text: Kind words and much appreciated!

text: I asked for a quote for two sides. I was given a price. I asked if that was the price for both sides. He said yes. I got the vehicle, immediately noticed the horrible alignment, had it inspected, and was told that the alignment was, as I suspected, terrible.

text: We've had one good experience with these folks and two bad ones. They have some skilled electrical technicians capable of figuring out difficult electrical issues. Another time they overcharged for correcting an easily diagnosable connection problem in the ignition system. No parts were replaced, probably less than an hour of labor was involved, and the bill was a few hundred dollars. When I politely questioned them on the bill, the guy became agitated, tried to change the subject, explained how I was lucky they didn't charge much more to get my car back.
